unnormalised: Someone asked me how important statistics are in cricket. Well, let me tell you about a match I watched recently - India vs. Pakistan in the Asia Cup. India needed 15 runs in the last over. The commentator kept mentioning Bumrahâ€™s economy rate of just 3.2 runs/over in the death overs that series. It built up the tension.
normalised: Someone asked me how important statistics are in cricket. Well, let me tell you about a match I watched recently - India versus Pakistan in the Asia Cup. India needed fifteen runs in the last over. The commentator kept mentioning Bumrah's economy rate of just three point two runs per over in the death overs that series. It built up the tension.

unnormalised: Then, the batsman, Jadeja, hit a six! The stats flashed on the screen - Jadeja's highest score in the last 5 matches was only 28. The commentator emphasized how crucial this innings could be for his career. Honestly, I had forgotten he even played the last few matches because of his low scores.
normalised: Then, the batsman, Jadeja, hit a six! The stats flashed on the screen - Jadeja's highest score in the last five matches was only twenty eight. The commentator emphasized how crucial this innings could be for his career. Honestly, I had forgotten he even played the last few matches because of his low scores.

unnormalised: After that six, the required run rate dropped to 9. Suddenly, they showed Pakistan's bowler, Shaheen Afridi's, average against top-order batsmen in the powerplay - a whopping 45! But the odds shifted again when Jadeja got out on the next ball. His final score was 42, a significant contribution.
normalised: After that six, the required run rate dropped to nine. Suddenly, they showed Pakistan's bowler, Shaheen Afridi's, average against top-order batsmen in the powerplay - a whopping forty five! But the odds shifted again when Jadeja got out on the next ball. His final score was forty two, a significant contribution.

unnormalised: Ultimately, India won the match by 3 wickets, achieving a score of 285/7. The post-match analysis was filled with comparisons of strike rates, averages, and even the number of dot balls bowled by each team. So, yeah, statistics definitely add a whole new layer of excitement to the game.
normalised: Ultimately, India won the match by three wickets, achieving a score of two hundred and eighty five divided by seven. The post-match analysis was filled with comparisons of strike rates, averages, and even the number of dot balls bowled by each team. So, yeah, statistics definitely add a whole new layer of excitement to the game.
